title: Rambles in Europe:

snippet: In the days of warfare between England and Scotland  there was a line of fortresses in the valley of the Tweed, above and below Peebles, which existed as a means of defence against the English  marauders.

title: Rambles in Europe:
author: Morrison, Leonard Allison
snippet: After a four-hours ride from Gretna Junction, through a section rich in history and beautiful in scenery, and passing through Moffatt, Symington, and other interesting towns, we entered the finely situated city of Peebles, on the banks of the Tweed, and secluded among the Scottish hills.
